revised_title: Combustion of Gaseous Mixtures and Inflammable Gases
tldr: The author, Humphry Davy, conducted experiments on the combustion of gaseous mixtures and discovered a method to preserve a continued light in inflammable gas and air mixtures without flame. He found that platinum wire could glow in these mixtures, and this phenomenon could be used to light coal-miners' safety lamps in non-explosive mixtures and indicate the state of the air in mines.
